questions.text: Who said they were double parked outside?
questions.explanation:
Lilith.

	Lilith was coming in to get Frasiser. She told him they had to hurry because she was double parked outside.

Sam and Woody.

	Sam was late because of a circus that was in town. Woody was late because he was auditioning for a play.

questions.text: What play did Woody do in high school?
questions.explanation:
"Hello, Donald!".

	Norm said, "Isn't that supposed to be "Hello, Dolly!?" Woody replied that Donald was the only one who could sing the part, so they had to change the name.

questions.text: What part was Woody the understudy for?
questions.explanation:
Mark Twain.

	Woody started to wear a Mark Twain costume everyday to work. He said as an understudy he had to be ready at any time to go on.

questions.text: How did Carla know Grif Palmer?
questions.correct: He was the janitor at her kids' school.
options: He once saved her child from drowning.
He rode on the subway with her.
questions.explanation:
He was the janitor at her kids' school.

	Grif Palmer was also Woody's play director. He was played by John Paragon.

questions.text: Who did Woody say that Mary, the older woman at the bar, looked like?
questions.explanation:
Emily Dickinson.

	Woody said that Emily Dickinson was one of the "Authors in Hell" - that is she was one of the characters in the play he was an understudy for.

questions.text: Why did Frasier and Lilith lose a combined 11 pounds on their cruise?
questions.explanation:
wall to wall waves.

	They both got seasick and threw up so much they ended up losing weight. Frasier enjoyed the cruise, but Lilith did not to appear to have enjoyed it.

questions.text: Who got upset when told his mother was old?
questions.explanation:
Cliff.

	Cliff said, "My mom's not old and she's never gonna die before I do so just shut up, okay?" He got very upset whenever someone said anything about his mother.

questions.text: Who did Carla say Woody reminded her of?
questions.explanation:
Jed Clampett.

	Woody insulted Carla and she said the only reason she didn't "clean his clock" was because he reminded her of Jed Clampett. Jed Clampett was a character on the TV show "The Beverly Hillbillies".

July 23rd.

	Woody told Mary when his birthday was when he asked her to be his grandmother. Woody Harrelson's, who played Woody Boyd, birthday is July 23rd as well.
